HOP.NAME: Amarillo
HOP.NOTES: Discovered and introduced by Vigil Gamache Farms Inc. in Washington State. Character similar to Cascade. Often used as a late kettle or dry hop addition to American style Pale Ales and IPA’s due to its signature aroma characteristics. Used for both bitterness and aroma. Used for: IPAs, Ales Aroma: Intensely fruity (citrus, melon, and stone friuts), floral, tropical notes. Substitutes: Cascade, Centennial, Simcoe Storage: Good 8-11% AA / 6-7% Beta

HOP.NAME: Amarillo
HOP.NOTES: Discovered and introduced by Vigil Gamache Farms Inc. in Washington State. Character similar to Cascade. Often used as a late kettle or dry hop addition to American style Pale Ales and IPA’s due to its signature aroma characteristics. Used for both bitterness and aroma. Used for: IPAs, Ales Aroma: Intensely fruity (citrus, melon, and stone friuts), floral, tropical notes. Substitutes: Cascade, Centennial, Simcoe Storage: Good 8-11% AA / 6-7% Beta

HOP.NAME: Citra
HOP.NOTES: Special aroma hops released in 2007. Imparts high alpha/oil content but low cohumulone. Aroma: Adds interesting citrus and tropical fruit character to the beer. Substitutes: Unknown

HOP.NAME: Galaxy
HOP.NOTES: A high alpha, dual purpose seedless hops with a unique hop aroma. It can be used either for bittering or as a late hop addition to provide a flavor of citrus and passionfruit to the finished beer. Aroma: Intense, pleasant, unique.

HOP.NAME: Mosaic (HBC 369)
HOP.NOTES: Available in quantity for the first time after 2012 harvest. Still known to many as HBC 369. A daughter of Simcoe crossed with a Nugget derived male. An excellent aroma variety. Used for: Ales, IPA, Experimental Ales Aroma: Rich in mango, lemon, citrus, pine, and notably, blueberry. Substitutes: Unknown Storage: Good (25% AA after 6 months at 20 C) 11-13.5% AA / 3.2-3.9% Beta

HOP.NAME: Citra
HOP.NOTES: Special aroma hops released in 2007. Imparts high alpha/oil content but low cohumulone. Aroma: Adds interesting citrus and tropical fruit character to the beer. Substitutes: Unknown

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt (2 Row) US
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Base malt for all beer styles

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Pale Malt, Maris Otter
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Premium base malt from the UK. Popular for many English styles of beer including ales, pale ales and bitters.

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Wheat, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Flaked wheat adds to increased body and foam retention Used in place of raw or torrified wheat for faster conversion and better yield. May be used in small amounts to improve head retention and body Examples: Belgian White beer, Wit

FERMENTABLE.NAME: Oats, Flaked
FERMENTABLE.NOTES: Adds body, mouth feel and head retention to the beer Used in oatmeal stouts and porters Adds substantial protein haze to light beers Protein rest recommended unless flakes are pregelatinized

YEAST.NAME: Morgans English Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Fast starting, fast fermenting yeast. Quick attenuation helps to produce a clean, crisp, clear ale. Can be used in a wide range of ales.

STYLE.NAME: American Amber Ale
STYLE.NOTES: Variation of the American Pale Ale style from the West Coast. Slightly darker in color and more caramel flavor than American Pale.
STYLE.PROFILE: Medium body, less malty with noticable caramel/crystal malt flavor. Medium to high hop rate with corresponding aroma. Light copper to brown in color. Fruity and estery with low diacetyl. Moderate carbonation.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: American 2-row Pale Malt. Medium to dark crystal malt. American hops. Dry hopping for aroma. American ale yeast.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: North Coast Red Seal Ale, Fat Tire Amber Ale, Full Sail Amber Ale

EQUIPMENT.NAME: ROBOBREW
EQUIPMENT.NOTES: Equipment Profile created by Brian from Short Circuited Brewers. Any questions comments or concerns can be direct to Brian@shortcircuitedbrewers.com

MASH.NAME: Robobrew Mash and Sparge Med Body
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.76 l of water at 71.2 C
